data.title: The Iron Master (1933)
data.meta_description: The wealthy owner of an iron foundry dies, and his greedy heirs are outraged when they find out that he left his entire estate not to them but to the foreman of his foundry.
data.text:
Not that good of a movie, but I loved when Reginald Denny's character found out when the girlfriend of that the awful brother was seeing was no good and same with the man who was posing as some count when he was just a barber! ðŸ˜‚

Reggie was looking handsome, but deserved better than this! ðŸ˜ž

A society family's fortune is put in a steel worker's hands and they don't like it! An annoying cheap drama where the snobbish family are beyond caricatures. J. Farrell MacDonald is likable, but Reginald Denny struggles to be the authoritarian and you don't for one second believe Lila Lee is reformed. Less said about the brother, the better.
